13:00.race_name: Floyd's Turfcare & Weed Solutions Ltd Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.comment: Acts well on soft ground; convincing winner (2m3f) recently; going the right way
runners.name: Luwdvig
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a soft-ground bumper and he had a recent Lingfield handicap (2m3f, soft) in the bag from a fair way out; under a big weight with his penalty on this quickish return but he is going the right way.

runners.comment: Irish point winner; minor 2m form but of more interest now handicapping up in trip
runners.name: Monsieur Jaco
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point last May (good; second now has a mark of 111); minor form in three qualifying runs in 2m hurdles but he's of more interest now handicapping up in trip, even if fitting a hood adds a warning note.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Honguenet
runners.comment: Faded over 2m2f at Exeter on handicap debut; better over 1m7f since; stamina query today
runners.name: Good For You
runners.spotlight: Faded over about 2m2f on handicap debut at Exeter (soft) but he fared better back at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft; first-time blinkers, retained) last month; has hopes of better but some stamina queries remain over this far on a stiff track.

runners.comment: Won 2m4f maiden on heavy; creditable second 15 days ago but remote second yesterday
runners.name: Gower Spirit
runners.spotlight: Improved for the longer trip and easier company when winning a mares' maiden at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy) in November; has had some excuses since, not least when trying to give weight to an improver at Hereford 15 days ago; however, beaten a lot further when second of four there in the 4.30 yesterday.

runners.comment: Finished remote latest but has possibilities on previous C&D run when a close 3rd
runners.name: Highbury Hill
runners.spotlight: Two good efforts in the autumn included a close third of 11 finishers to Crossbeau over C&D (good to soft) but she finished remote at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft; has acted on that surface) in December; needs to return to earlier level.

runners.comment: All five wins over fences but has a lower hurdle mark; went close on only previous C&D run
runners.name: Boston Joe
runners.spotlight: All five wins over fences but he has a lower hurdle mark and may well have a win in him in this sphere, having run creditably at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) in October following a break; went close in one previous C&D hurdle run in late 2024 and can be involved again.

runners.comment: Promise in soft-ground bumpers; should improve now handicapping but this might be needed
runners.name: Ocean Walz
runners.spotlight: Promising in bumpers, including on soft; lesser efforts over hurdles so far, for previous yard and this one, but it wouldn't surprise if he fared better in handicaps in due course; today's run might be needed though.

runners.breeder: Phillip C And Mrs Kathryn M Dando
runners.comment: Some promise in good-ground hurdles at 2m/2m4f, including on handicap debut; off since May
runners.name: Dessie Haze
runners.spotlight: Has shown some promise in good-ground hurdles over 2m and 2m4f, latterly on handicap debut at Ffos Las last May, but he has more to prove on first run since and back on soft ground.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs B E Moore
runners.comment: Running well in handicaps at about this trip in early 2025; not so good this winter
runners.name: Dont Tell Rosie
runners.spotlight: Was running well in handicaps at about this trip early in 2025 but she hasn't got to grips with this season so far and was well back at Warwick after Christmas; now goes without regular hood.

runners.comment: Some good efforts at about this trip, including over C&D; can go well now back here
runners.name: Locked Down Lad
runners.spotlight: Won point bumper in 2024; very likely to have a handicap in him on some good runs at around this trip, including over C&D (good to soft) in November, when staying on well to take a late second to Crossbeau, just ahead of Highbury Hill; brought down early latest; can go well back over C&D.

runners.comment: Made light of absence when C&D winner in November; lesser run since; chance on earlier run
runners.name: Crossbeau
runners.spotlight: Made light of a lengthy absence when winning over C&D (good to soft; made most) from Locked Down Lad and Highbury Hill in November but he couldn't repeat the form at Fontwell (about 2m1f, heavy; has form on that surface) last month; well worth another chance back over C&D.

runners.comment: Well treated on best handicap hurdle form, including over C&D, but below form this winter
runners.name: Out Of Focus
runners.spotlight: Has often run well in handicap hurdles, including over C&D on heavy, but below best this winter despite falling in the weights and he didn't put up much of a show last time out; first-time cheekpieces on.

runners.comment: Well held in three 2m hurdles; bred to improve for the step up in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Rest Is The Best
runners.spotlight: Well held in three 2m hurdles on soft but she does have some possibilities on pedigree of improving for the step up in trip now switched to a handicap; others still look more likely.

runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut latest; this trip is more suitable but no great appeal on form
runners.name: Getaway Sam
runners.spotlight: Minor form so far and was very tired when pulling up before two out on handicap debut at Hereford (3m1f, soft) 15 days ago; this trip should be more suitable but down the list for win purposes.

runners.comment: Not yet looked like getting off the mark over hurdles, including in three handicaps
runners.name: Saccary
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins at about 1m2f on the continent; not yet looked like adding to them over hurdles, including in three handicaps at up to 2m1f and he's no good thing to appreciate this longer trip on testing ground.

runners.comment: Slight query about soft ground but continued in good form since 2m5f win on good to soft
runners.name: Atlantic Power
runners.spotlight: Has a slight query about how soft he wants it but he's continued in good form since winning over 2m5f at Fontwell (good to soft) in October and is entitled to be involved again.

13:30.race_name: LSL Racing Sales & Syndication Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Flat winner; hurdle debut 4th gives him something to build; others have achieved far more
runners.name: Berkshire Smudge
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.spotlight: Class 6 Flat handicap winner (1m2f, soft) whose hurdle debut fourth at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) last month gives him something to build on; however, others in this line-up have achieved considerably more.

runners.comment: Runner-up on first two hurdle starts; unseated last time; he's one to consider
runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.spotlight: Much better over hurdles than on the Flat, finishing second on first two runs in this code (2m1f/2m, heavy/good); prominent when unseating three out at Ascot (1m7f, soft) last time; he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Ran okay when third on hurdle debut; improvement needed but he's in good hands to progress
runners.name: Jedhi Knight
runners.spotlight: Class 6 Flat handicap winner (2m, good to soft) who ran okay when third on his hurdle/stable debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month; improvement needed but he's in good hands to progress; not discounted.

runners.breeder: P Coutereel D Parreau-Delhote & J Charm
runners.comment: Runner-up on sole French hurdle start and has joined a top yard for his British career
runners.name: Misterdoc
runners.spotlight: French bumper winner (1m4f, good to soft) who was runner-up on hurdle debut at Auteuil (2m2f, very soft) in October; he's joined a top trainer for his British career and is high on the list.

runners.comment: Listed third against males at Aintree latest and she's a possible player under 7lb penalty
runners.name: Only One Blue
runners.spotlight: Won on hurdle/stable debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in October and runner-up at Hereford (2m, good) in November before Listed third against males at Aintree (2m1f, soft); she's a possible player under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Third on hurdle debut at Kempton and he's open to improvement for last year's winning yard
runners.name: Senator
runners.spotlight: Third on both Flat starts in France (good to soft/soft) and filled same position on recent hurdle/stable debut at Kempton (2m, good); that was a warm race and he's open to improvement for last year's winning yard; big chance.

runners.comment: Novicey jumping on hurdle but in top hands and there can be optimism he'll improve
runners.name: Thewoodcorner
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner (2m, soft) whose jumping was novicey when sixth of eight on hurdle/stable debut at Sandown (2m, soft) last month, beaten just under 9l; however, that looked a warm race and there can be optimism he'll improve for his top trainer; firmly in calculations.

14:02.race_name: Albert Bartlett Triple Crown Series Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)

runners.comment: Clear second at Ludlow last month; this slower ground ought to suit even better
runners.name: West To The Bridge
runners.spotlight: Long in the tooth now and not the force of old but was nudged up only 1lb for last month's clear second in refitted cheekpieces at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) and ought to be better suited by this slower ground.

runners.comment: Safely held on both starts since rejoining this yard; others have much less to prove
runners.name: Pyramid Place
runners.owner: Royal Arch Racing Pp & Gary Campbell
runners.spotlight: Nine hurdle wins (various ground), including valuable C&D race in 2023; safely held on both starts since rejoining Harriet Dicken, though, and has much more to prove than some of these; cheekpieces added to usual hood.

runners.comment: Clear second of four on last month's stable debut; still well handicapped on older form
runners.name: Bingoo
runners.spotlight: Disappointing during light campaign for James Moffatt last season but made encouraging stable debut when clear second of four at Leicester (1m7f, soft) last month; still well handicapped on older form and will be suited by this move back up in trip; player if that recent run brought him on.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant
runners.comment: Won his first two handicaps (both 2m); not at best last time but may still have potential
runners.name: French Emperor
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap/seasonal debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October and followed up in big field at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November; slightly disappointing when favourite at Cheltenham last month but could still have more improvement to come over today's longer trip.

runners.comment: Multiple point winner who returned to rules with three good runs at end of last year
runners.name: El Capitaine
runners.spotlight: Multiple point winner who scored at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good to soft) on rules return in October and was placed on both subsequent outings (2m5f/3m); this drop back in trip may not be ideal but he ought to go well again.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant & J Le Roux
runners.comment: Ran quite well on faster-than-ideal ground when back over hurdles last month; interesting
runners.name: Castelfort
runners.spotlight: Didn't really take to chasing on first two starts this season but kept on for respectable fifth when back over hurdles at Newbury (2m4f, good) last month, and this dual course winner ought to be better suited by today's slower ground.

runners.comment: Beat a dual subsequent winner when scoring by 4l over C&D on handicap debut; respected
runners.name: High Tea
runners.spotlight: Beat a dual subsequent winner when scoring by 4l over C&D (soft) on handicap debut in November and held every chance before penultimate-flight fall at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft; race in which West To The Bridge finished second) last month; now 13b above his winning mark but must be considered.

runners.breeder: K Perreau L Colson & E Lejault
runners.comment: 1-8 over hurdles; ran well in defeat two starts ago but others have stronger claims here
runners.name: Walkadina
runners.owner: Prof C Tisdall J White & A Underhill
runners.spotlight: 1-8 over hurdles; ran well behind revitalised opponent at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) last month and will be fine over today's trip but wasn't in the same form at Ascot (1m7f, soft) a fortnight later; others preferred.

runners.breeder: A F G & Mrs S L Brimble
runners.comment: Fell last month but was 3-3 in handicaps beforehand and remains of strong interest
runners.name: Grenadier Jed
runners.spotlight: Progressive 6yo who made it 3-3 in handicaps when keeping on strongly to lead close home on seasonal debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) in November; fell mid-race last month but remains very much of interest.

runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Placed twice this season but didn't fire last time and the headgear is left off again here
runners.name: Torrent
runners.spotlight: Placed on two of his four starts this season, latterly when swapping cheekpieces for first-time visor at Sandown (2m, soft) in early December; safely held over 2m4f at Newbury last time, though, and the headgear is left off again here.

runners.comment: Won this race and two other hurdles last season; chasing has not gone to plan this term
runners.name: Boyles Hill
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner last season, most recently off mark 1lb lower than today's in this race (heavy); chasing has not gone to plan this term (three attempts) but he might fare better now back over hurdles.

runners.comment: Just 1-21 over hurdles in Ireland but Sean Bowen is booked for stable debut
runners.name: Slim Marvel
runners.spotlight: 1-21 over hurdles for Andrew Slattery in Ireland, signing off with 40l defeat on slow ground in November; makes stable debut from a workable mark, though, and with Sean Bowen booked; cheekpieces removed after one use.

14:37.race_name: Kingsbridge Mortgage "Chasing Excellence" Novices' Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 2-2 over hurdles, and has made promising start to chase career; good prospect
runners.name: Juby Ball
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over hurdles last season; had to battle hard to justify skinny odds on seasonal/chase debut at Carlisle (2m, soft; four fences omitted) in November and fell at third-last fence when travelling well at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) this month but remains a very interesting chasing prospect.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Croix Sonnet Et Al
runners.comment: Good C&D winner on chase debut; weakened quickly last time, having raced too freely
runners.name: Palacio
runners.spotlight: Made very good start to chasing career in November, scoring by over 8l over C&D (good; also suited by soft); contender if judged on that performance but weakened quickly at Newbury later that month, having raced too freely, and is not one to rely upon heavily.

runners.comment: Came second in Class 5 handicap in November but faces a tough task on these terms
runners.name: Dj Pete
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over fences; ran well when second to progressive rival in Class 5 handicap at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) in November but two lesser efforts have followed and he faces a very tough task on these terms; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Made the frame in three low-grade handicap hurdles this season; tall order on chase debut
runners.name: Storming Nelson
runners.spotlight: 1-13 over hurdles; has arrested his decline and made the frame in three low-grade handicaps this season (2m-2m5f) but takes on some useful rivals on this chasing debut.

runners.comment: Tends to race too freely but ran well in first two chases and has good chance on figures
runners.name: Stencil
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner in France in 2024; has a tendency to race too freely but ran well for a long way before fading into fifth in Grade 2 novice chase at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November and kept on pretty well for second behind next-time-out winner in Ascot handicap (2m1f, soft; first-time hood) last month; favoured by the weights here and a major player.

15:12.race_name: Taffy Jenkins Memorial Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Turned over at short odds last time but came second in a Listed race on hurdle debut
runners.name: Charisma Cat
runners.spotlight: 3-5 in bumpers last season, with latest win gained at Listed level, and clear second in Listed novice hurdle at Newbury (2m, soft) on return in November; turned over at short odds at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) on Boxing Day but didn't run badly and has strong claims.

runners.comment: Bought for big money after Irish point win; in contention when unseating on rules debut
runners.name: Clondaw Park
runners.spotlight: Made all and jumped well for an easy win on Irish point debut last February (heavy ground), after which she changed hands for £320,000; in contention before unseating rider at third-last flight in Newbury Listed race (2m, soft; Charisma Cat finished second) in November; could still be anything.

runners.comment: Placed in all three points; makes hurdling debut today
runners.name: Cue Jump
runners.spotlight: Ran as though something was amiss when making rules debut in a bumper last spring but was placed in all three of her points and evidently has some ability; makes hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Needs to learn to settle better but both hurdle runs were quite encouraging
runners.name: Daring To Dream
runners.spotlight: Began hurdling career with two quite encouraging runs, latterly when fourth of 12 at Hereford (2m, soft) a fortnight ago; needs to learn to settle better but has realistic each-way claims.

runners.comment: Showed no promise on first four hurdling starts
runners.name: Dont Cheddar Tear
runners.spotlight: Showed no promise on first four hurdling starts (2m-2m5f); impossible to recommend.

runners.comment: Struggled and was pulled up when a big-priced outsider for last season's bumper debut
runners.name: Issadora
runners.spotlight: Second foal from a fair Flat stayer; struggled and was pulled up 3f out when a big-priced outsider for last season's bumper debut.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De LOrne
runners.comment: Useful in bumpers; only eighth on hurdle debut at Newbury but that was in a good race
runners.name: Kapability
runners.spotlight: Beat a good mare on bumper debut at Aintree (good) in October 2024 and was fourth in soft-ground Listed bumper at Huntingdon a few weeks later; weakened into eighth on seasonal/hurdle debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November but that was a good race and the first-time tongue-tie might aid her finishing effort.

runners.comment: Made low-key hurdle debut in the autumn and remains best watched
runners.name: Karlita Desbois
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far on last season's bumper debut but made low-key hurdle debut in the autumn and remains best watched.

runners.comment: Not disgraced when remote fourth on recent hurdle debut at Ffos Las but needs to improve
runners.name: Man Maid
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when remote fourth on recent hurdle debut at Ffos Las (2m, soft) but needs significant improvement to trouble the principals.

runners.comment: Second in bumper on rules debut but only third of five when odds-on for hurdle debut
runners.name: Trinity Street
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who came second in soft-ground Carlisle bumper on rules debut in November; managed only third of five when odds-on for last month's hurdle debut at Hexham (2m, heavy), though, and needs to take a big step forward.

runners.comment: Displayed promise on first two starts but is probably one for further down the line
runners.name: Milady Du Breuil
runners.spotlight: Displayed promise on both starts against own age-group in the autumn (bumper/hurdle) but is probably one for a bit further down the line.

15:47.race_name: Floyd's Turfcare & Weed Solutions Ltd Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Long in the tooth now but ought to find this much easier than last month's seasonal debut
runners.name: Supervisor
runners.owner: Mrs Julia Young And Venetia Williams
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his two soft-ground chase wins in early 2024 and is a 12yo now, but faced very tough task from out of the weights here on last month's seasonal debut and contests this easier race from a workable mark.

runners.comment: Not one to rely upon heavily but he's on a good mark and this track suits him well
runners.name: Bells Of Peterboro
runners.spotlight: Not one to rely upon heavily and doesn't always look wildly enthusiastic but didn't run badly when fourth at Uttoxeter (3m heavy) last month and this track suits him well; on a good mark; can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Placed over 2m3f here on seasonal/chase debut; very unexposed as a stayer; interesting
runners.name: Genietoile
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 8yo who was placed here (2m3f, good to soft) on seasonal debut in November; fell at first fence on latest outing but could still have significant potential over staying trips; high on the list.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on old form but pulled up on only outing since 2023
runners.name: Bali Body
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced for his age and well handicapped on old form, but he returned from a one-year absence with a disappointing run in December 2024 and has been off for another 417 days since.

runners.comment: 0-9 over fences but ran quite well on seasonal debut and is on a good mark
runners.name: Phantom Getaway
runners.spotlight: 0-9 and essentially disappointing since switched to fences in 2023, but he ran quite well when fourth on seasonal debut at Ffos Las (3m, soft) and is well handicapped if judged on last season's placed form.

runners.comment: Placed in 14-runner Ayr chase when upped to 3m this month; cheekpieces are now added
runners.name: Dangerous Touch
runners.spotlight: Lacked fluency and was a bit disappointing in his first two chases (both 2m4f) but his third of 14 at Ayr (3m, soft) this month was a good effort; still very unexposed at around 3m; big player if new cheekpieces help.

runners.comment: Well beaten in six hurdle races for this stable; still worth a glance in the betting
runners.name: The Jam Man
runners.spotlight: Teenager who was a very useful hurdler/chaser in his prime; well beaten in all six hurdle races for current stable since August but has plummeted down the weights and is worth a glance in the betting on return to fences.

runners.comment: Struggled in competitive marathon last week but was in good form beforehand
runners.name: Ali Star Bert
runners.spotlight: Ended 2025 with two wins at Southwell (3m, soft/good to soft), looking in particularly good nick on latter occasion; struggled from just out of the weights in last week's Surrey National at Lingfield but enters calculations in this easier race.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 7yo who was running well last time before two slow jumps cost him ground
runners.name: Star Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on seasonal/handicap/chase debut in November but was running well until two slow jumps cost him ground on final circuit at Warwick (3m, soft; ended up well held in third) last month; remains lightly raced and still has a bigger performance in him.

runners.comment: Didn't run badly on recent chasing debut (2m4f) but others appeal more all the same
runners.name: The Grey Man
runners.spotlight: Kept on for very respectable fourth over hurdles at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) on seasonal debut in October and his recent chasing debut was better than the bare form suggests, given he sprawled on landing at the fourth-last fence; open to improvement over this new trip but others appeal more.

runners.comment: Returned from long layoff with three disappointing runs this season; headgear switched
runners.name: Bolsover Bill
runners.spotlight: Began 2024 with two 2m3f Exeter wins and was subsequently placed over C&D; very well handicapped on those heroics but returned from long layoff with three disappointing runs this season and needs a revival; swaps usual cheekpieces for blinkers.

runners.comment: Third in first two chases; latest run best overlooked but he remains unproven on soft
runners.name: The Magus
runners.spotlight: Won handicap hurdle debut here (2m3f, good) at end of last season and launched chasing career with two thirds in the autumn (2m5f/2m7f, good); things went pear-shaped very early on at Hereford this month and that run can be overlooked, but he still needs to prove himself on soft ground.

runners.comment: Very unexposed but needs significant improvement on this chase/handicap debut
runners.name: The Moonlight Man
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 7yo who won a slow-ground Irish point just over a year ago; completed only one of his three hurdle races, when well-held fourth in uncompetitive novice here (2m7f, good to soft) last month; needs significant improvement to overcome opening mark on chase/handicap debut.

runners.comment: Left clear to score at Taunton last month and could still have a lot more to offer
runners.name: Fat Faced Columbo
runners.spotlight: Very close second to progressive rival on seasonal/handicap/chase debut in November, then was left clear to score at Taunton (2m7f, good; final-fence faller won next time out) last month; 8lb higher here and not sure to be ideally suited by the slower ground, but still commands respect.

runners.comment: Ex-French maiden; made low-key British debut in recent novice hurdle
runners.name: Roi Lion
runners.spotlight: Ex-French maiden who made low-key return from a mammoth absence when tailed off in 2m3f novice hurdle on recent British debut; tries a new trip on chase return; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner last season but has not fired on his two outings this term
runners.name: John W Creasy
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last season (2m/2m3f); still unexposed over this sort of trip but did not fire on first two appearances this term (2m5f/3m) and others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Two respectable runs followed his breakthrough win; needs to kick on again today
runners.name: The Big Reveal
runners.spotlight: Came good with ready win on seasonal debut at Lingfield (2m7f, good) despite jockey losing irons on run-in; both subsequent runs were perfectly respectable but he needs to kick on again to land this prize.

16:22.race_name: LSL Racing Sales & Syndication National Hunt Flat Race (Conditionals/Amateurs) (Cat 1 Elim') (GBB)

runners.comment: Struggled in Listed race last time but won quite comfortably on debut in October
runners.name: Barrow Hill Lad
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful jumper and beat his nine rivals quite comfortably at Ffos Las (soft; Big John Ollie third) in October; struggled in a subsequent Listed race but back in calmer waters here and has a big role to play.

runners.comment: Beaten under 4l when keeping-on third behind Barrow Hill Lad at Ffos Las in October
runners.name: Big John Ollie
runners.spotlight: No significant threat to Barrow Hill Lad when keeping-on third at Ffos Las (soft) in October but stuck to his task well and was beaten under 4l in the end; open to improvement and goes on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Out of a well-connected French chase winner; stable does well in bumpers
runners.name: Justalargewhisky
runners.spotlight: 77,000euros yearling; second foal; dam French 2m1f chase winner, half-sister to useful jumper Bass Rock and to two Listed French jumps winners; stable has good strike-rate in bumpers (15%); no surprise if he features on debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.comment: Lacked a change of gear when fourth over C&D on debut; slower ground may help today
runners.name: Keltype
runners.spotlight: 4-1, kept on for respectable fourth of eight over C&D (good to soft) on last month's debut; seemed to lack a change of gear when the pace lifted that day and might be seen to better effect on this slower ground; a possible.

runners.comment: Out of a bumper winner but 50-1 and well beaten on last month's debut at Exeter (soft)
runners.name: Mr Winter
runners.spotlight: Out of a bumper winner but 50-1 and well beaten on last month's debut at Exeter (soft).

runners.breeder: S A S Ecurie Madame Patrick Papot
runners.comment: Out of half-sister to French Grade 3 hurdle winner; yard doesn't run that many in bumpers
runners.name: Nez Vert
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to a French/Czech jumps winner; dam French hurdle winner, half-sister to a French Grade 3 hurdle winner and a useful French hurdler/chaser; trainer doesn't run that many in bumpers; market may guide.

runners.comment: Out of a dual hurdle runner-up; rare bumper runner for Flat-oriented stable
runners.name: Thepassingcyclone
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam runner-up in 2m/2m5f hurdle races, out of bumper/1m6f Flat winner; rare bumper runner for Flat-oriented stable; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.comment: Half-brother to useful hurdler/chaser Classic Ben; the market may point the way
runners.name: The Quant
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to useful hurdler/chaser Classic Ben and fair 3m hurdle winner Stolen Money; dam point winner; will probably need a stiffer test of stamina to be seen to best effect but good market support will bring him into the equation.

runners.comment: Created a good impression when winning against his own age-group at Huntingdon
runners.name: Westbrooke Boy
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to smart Flat/jumps winner Stratum; 6-1, won readily against his own age-group at Huntingdon (good to soft; nine ran) in November and looks a leading player against older rivals today.

runners.comment: Modest form so far and marked improvement needed

runners.spotlight: Modest form so far and marked improvement needed.

runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 1-49 and comfortably held in both his races after a long absence.
